epd_metadata.owner_address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives, placed on building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure; includes high-strength, high-durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D
lca_information.reference_service_life: Not specified (scope is cradle to delivery)

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Extraction, transport and manufacturing of raw materials; generation of electricity for modules A1 and A3
system_boundaries.core_processes: External transportation of materials, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), treatment of waste and wastewater
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, wastage, transport and treatment of waste at end of life

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.activities_included: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes pre-installation activities

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected during deconstruction; transport distances assumed due to lack of primary data

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, offsetting some emissions
carbonation.consideration: Not included in this EPD results; recommended to consider in whole-of-life building studies per BS EN 16757:2017

allocation_approach.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_approach.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically due to significant economic value
allocation_approach.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data: Default background data from LCA databases used; AusLCI dataset conforms to EN 15804 allocation rules

additional_info.product_classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail
additional_info.sustainability_strategy: Industry's first 2050 net-zero targets endorsed by Science Based Targets initiative (SBTi)
references: Australasian EPD Programme. (2017, 2018, 2024). Guidance and Instructions.
Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (AusLCI). (2023). Guidelines for Data Development.
British Standards Institution. (2017, 2019). BS EN 15804 and BS EN 16757 standards.
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water. (2023). National Waste Report 2022.
EPD International. (2024). General Programme Instructions and Product Category Rules.
Green Building Council of Australia. (2022). Upfront carbon conversation.
Man Yu et al. (2017). The Carbon Footprint of Australia's Construction Sector.
World Green Building Council. (2019). Bringing embodied carbon upfront.
